text: Pleasant Valley, is a ghost town, a historical mining town, and a former populated place in White Pine County, Nevada. There was a post office from March 1892 until April 1894. In 1997, there were 8 families associated with the Apostolic United Brethren living at Pleasant Valley. ==See also== * 1915 Pleasant Valley earthquake - named for Pleasant Valley in Pershing County, Nevada * Pleasant Valley, Nevada - a very small unincorporated community in Washoe County == References == Category:Ghost towns in White Pine County, Nevada Category:Ghost towns in Nevada
title: Pleasant Valley, White Pine County, Nevada
